isis.stitle: 13 SPEED AND 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-713/18 SERIES - REMOVE - AUXILIARY SECTION

note.para: There can be different bolt lengths; note their location.
Auxiliary sections can be removed either with transmission in the horizontal position or the vertical position.
Auxiliary countershaft retaining straps may be installed to hold the countershafts in place. Auxiliary can be removed without straps, use caution.

svcsubproc.title: To remove the auxiliary section in the horizontal position.

step1.para: Remove the four (4) bolts, auxiliary countershaft rear bearing cover, gasket and rear bearing shim ( Figure 21).

figure.caption: Figure 21. Remove Auxiliary Countershaft Rear Bearing Cover

step1.para: Install the auxiliary countershaft retaining covers with two 3/8" NC x 1" and one 3/8" NC x 1-1/2" clean bolts ( Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Install Auxiliary Countershaft Retaining Covers

note.para: Do not use an air gun. Tighten by hand until the bolts are snug.

step1.para: Remove the retaining bolts from the auxiliary section housing that attach the front section to the auxiliary section ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Remove Retaining Bolts From Auxiliary Section Housing

step1.para: Insert the two (2) longest bolts in the housing flange tapped holes. Tighten evenly to move the auxiliary section away from the front box. Go far enough to break the gasket seal ( Figure 23).
Remove the bolts from the tapped holes.
Attach an auxiliary section hanger bracket to the top of the auxiliary section ( Figure 24).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Attach Lifting Chain to Auxiliary Section Hanger Bracket

step1.para: Attach a lifting chain to the auxiliary section hanger bracket ( Figure 24).
Move assembly to the rear until auxiliary section is free.
Remove the gasket and clean all mounting surfaces of gasket material.

svcsubproc.title: To remove the auxiliary section in the vertical position.

step1.para: With blocks under the clutch housing to prevent input shaft damage, place transmission in the vertical position, clutch housing down.
Remove the four (4) bolts and the auxiliary countershaft rear bearing cover, gasket, and rear bearing shim ( Figure 25).

figure.caption: Figure 25. Remove Auxiliary Countershaft Rear Bearing Cover

step1.para: Install auxiliary countershaft retaining straps with two 3/8" NC x 1" and one 3/8" NC x 1-1/2" clean bolts ( Figure 26).

figure.caption: Figure 26. Install Auxiliary Countershaft Retaining Straps

note.para: Do not use an air gun. Tighten by hand until the bolts are snug.

step1.para: Remove the retaining bolts that attach the front section to the auxiliary section ( Figure 27).

figure.caption: Figure 27. Remove Retaining Bolts From Front Section

step1.para: Install a steel bar through the yoke ( Figure 28).

figure.caption: Figure 28. Install Steel Bar Through Yoke

step1.para: Attach a lifting chain to the steel bar ( Figure 28).
Lift assembly from the front section.
Remove the gasket and clean all mounting surfaces of gasket material.
